definitions.definition: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.

definitions.example: The sculptor represented a horse in bronze.

definitions.definition: To portray by mimicry or acting; to act the part or character of
definitions.example: It has always been his dream to represent Hamlet on Broadway.

definitions.definition: To stand or act in the place of; to perform the duties, exercise the rights, or otherwise act on behalf of
definitions.example: An attorney's job is to represent his client in court

definitions.definition: To act as a representative of (a country, state, district etc.)
definitions.example: They chose a member of Congress to represent their district.

definitions.definition: To portray to another using language; to show; to give one's own impressions and judgement of
definitions.example: He represented that he was investigating for the police department.

definitions.definition: To give an account of; to describe.
To serve as a sign or symbol of
definitions.example: A dove is often used to represent peace.

definitions.definition: To bring a certain sensation of into the mind; to cause to be known, felt, or apprehended; to present.
To form or image again in consciousness, as an object of cognition or apprehension (something presentative, which was originally apprehended by direct presentation).
To constitute, to make up, to be an example of.
To participate as a team member
To constitute a good example or symbol of a group of people; to acquit oneself well.
